metadata.name: Her name was Emily
metadata.description:
Inspired by the poetry "Because I could not stop for Death" by Emily Dickinson, this piece talks about death as comfort that waits for a mortal life when the time comes around. This poetry has always been my favourite, as it gives me a sense of understanding to even look at death as a friend of immortality. This same understanding lead me to create this story and this piece of my vision, where I try to explore the same sentiment with a frame that defines the writer's persona. 

Where the writer herself waited and welcomed the old friend and described the path toward an end of a phase while understanding another unknown step. 

Link to her biography - https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poets/emily-dickinson

Team credits - Jophin, Anvesha and Lubaba
